text: Nathaniel [ nuh-than-yuhl ] is a commonly found male name in English that comes from the Hebrew language name Nathanael. It is often simplified into "Nate" or "Nathan." The name Nathaniel has been in use for many centuries and has a significant backstory and significance. It comes from the Hebrew name Netan'el, which translates to "gift of God." Nathaniel is referenced in the Bible as one of Jesus Christ's twelve apostles, who is also known as Bartholomew. The name Nathaniel is well-liked in various cultures and has been used for both male and female individuals. This name was ranked #133 on the US Popular Names in 2021. == People == * Nathaniel Lyon, first Union general to be killed in the American Civil War * Nathaniel Hawthorne, American novelist and short story writer * Nathaniel Wallich, surgeon and botanist of Danish origin who worked in India (1786-1854) ==References== Category:Given names
title: Nathaniel
